column4: source control is one of those things that once you get used to it, you wonder how insane it was when you did not have it
and when it saves your backside...
why would you want a GUI for a source control system?
I mean, how would you represent that in a GUI?
gui is really nice for example when looking at the log/history - i love bzr-explorer but don't like any git gui
i'm not sure what your question is - if you wan't to see it (and you use bzr) just install bzr-explorer - for git it's git-cola but i don't think it's that great so not sure if i'll use it
well, I don't know how you'd have a GUI for version control
it just kind of doesn't make sense to me
makes sense to me, if its a good gui :) for what i need out of bzr, bzr-explorer has me covered
ouais, vous obtiendrez plus de aide dans #ubuntu-fr
in case you're interested, bzr for git users (i'm reading up on git for bzr users): http://doc.bazaar.canonical.com/migration/en/survival/bzr-for-git-users.html
it keeps the really lazy skript kiddies out
eh, I've found it quietens things down a bit
bigbill : if you intend to use password on server, a much better option than changing port is to setup fail2ban
